page.title: 02SHEERLANDS FARM
page.content: Sheerlands Farm is the largest in the Pluckley area with 180 acres of land. Most of this is fruit orchards, although hops were grown until 1984. Fruit tree saplings are bought from Holland and Belgium. Six varieties of dessert apples are grown, Jonagold, Coxes, Discovery, Worcester, Tideman Worcester and Eider Red. While only two varieties of cooking apples, Grenedier and Bramley. Conference and Cornice pears are grown. The fruit is picked by hand and apples are stored at 42F. and pears at 29F. The apples are polished and graded into 7 different sizes. Bruised apples go for cider making. A computer linked to Canterbury organizes the dispatch of boxes of fruit to their destinations.
